name: Algeria
takeaway: In 2023, the relationship between China and Algeria significantly strengthened, particularly following President Tabboune's visit to China in July 2003. This visit led to over $36 billion in investments in Algeria across various sectors, including manufacturing, new technology, the knowledge economy, transport, military, and agriculture. In return, Algeria has strongly supported China's positions on issues related to Hong Kong, Taiwan, Tibet, and the Uyghur population.

The results indicate a robust military and security cooperation between Algeria and China. However, there is a notable culture of censorship in Algeria, which makes it challenging to accurately gauge the true
popular sentiment regarding the relationship between China and Algeria, especially concerning the Uyghur Muslim population.
description-1: In 2023, Algeria had a GDP per capita of US$5,260 and a total population of 45.83 million people.
description-2: Algeria established full diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China in 1958. Algeria was ranked 139th in Reporters Without Borders‘ 2024 World Press Freedom Index, and rated Not Free in Freedom House‘s 2024 Global Freedom Index, with a score of 32/100.

Media.evidence: Page 7 of this report says very few Chinese media in Afrtia and mostly based in South Africa.

Media.evidence:
1- Cooperation agreement between the newspapers "El Khabar" and China's "People's Daily."  June, 2024

2- "Towards Algerian-Chinese Cooperation in the Field of Digitization." May 2024
Media.note:
I believe that in 2024, media cooperation between China and Algeria improved tremendously. There were documented media visits to China and concrete cooperation agreements established.

2- Although this is an information technology agreement, media typically falls under the umbrella of information technology in Algeria.

Foreign Policy.evidence: The Algerian Parliament was fully keen to work with the Chinese Parliament, by intensifying parliamentary visits between the two sides and activating parliamentary friendship groups in order to accompany the dynamic witnessed by the governments of the two countries, according to a statement by the National Assembly. Nov 2022. Report 2: On Tuesday, at the headquarters of the National People's Assembly, the Algeria-China Friendship Parliamentary Group was installed with the aim of strengthening cooperation relations between the two countries.

Foreign Policy.evidence: ALGIERS, Jan. 16 (Xinhua) -- China and Algeria on Tuesday vowed to continue firm support to each other on issue. The 27th Chinese medical team to aid Algeria arrived in Saida on May 28 and conducted voluntary clinics.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence:
Since the implementation of the "Belt and Road" Initiative in Algeria, CITIC Construction has continuously nurtured the Sino-Algerian "flowers of friendship" with hard work and sincerity, and sowed seeds of hope and success in Algeria. Over the years, the company has contributed to the training and qualification of local employees in various fields, and has taken the initiative to invite Algerian engineers to receive training in China. It has created thousands of job opportunities for Algerian youth. Furthermore, the company has always been prompt in providing various types of support and humanitarian aid to the Algerian people during various occasions and natural disasters, using all its capabilities, including the free provision of Chinese traditional medicine services.

Despite the distance between them, China and Algeria are very close strategically, politically, and economically, as they developed relations that extended to important periods and milestones in the history of the two countries. This comparative study seeks to explore the issue of civil service training as a new area for convergence, exchange of lessons and intensification of cooperation between the two countries

November 2023  Article 3: Although Algeria does not have an allied relationship with either China or Russia, in contrast to Russia and Syria, it is important to note that Algeria has participated in multinational military manoeuvres in which China has also taken part, and hence said activity should be listed in this article. The Panamax 2022 manoeuvres, held from 12 to 27 August 2022 in Venezuela, allowed military personnel from both countries, as well as contingents from Russia, Belarus, India, Iran, Kazakhstan, Myanmar, Uzbekistan and Venezuela to share resources and procedures and become familiar with one another.

Law Enforcement.evidence: As China’s engagement with African countries has grown over the past several years, Beijing is turning to security contractors to protect its Belt and Road Initiative (BRI) projects, citizens, and diplomats. The China Security and Technology Group’s African operations are coordinated from Algeria, Angola, Mozambique, and Kenya, according to its website.  Report 2: In Algeria, for example, where this activity is strictly reserved for nationals, Chinese security companies operate by being integrated with their clients or within the framework of consulting and logistics offices.
Law Enforcement.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Law Enforcement.evidence: All schools in MPS’s International Law Enforcement Training Program have ties to specific African countries. Algeria, Lesotho, Mauritius and at least 20 other countries have relationships with the Special Police College, which conducts counter terrorism training. . Report 2: While much of the training happens in China, some takes place on the African continent, such as a joint Algerian-Chinese training program conducted at the Algerian Ministry of Interior and Local Authorities from 2015 to 2018.
Law Enforcement.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.
